title: Potion of berserk rage
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Potion                                                                                                     |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Potion of Berserk Rage                                                                                     |
| Icon | [![Potion of berserk rage.png](/images/0/03/Potion_of_berserk_rage.png)](/File:Potion_of_berserk_rage.png) |

|   |                                                      |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A potion which can send one into an incoherent rage. |

[Quaffing](/Quaff "Quaff") a **potion of berserk rage** makes you start [berserking](/Berserk "Berserk") for 10 to 19 turns (weighted toward 15). Berserk increases HP by +50%, gives you [might](/Might "Might") and [haste](/Haste "Haste"), and makes you immune to [sleep](/Sleep "Sleep"). However, your actions are limited to (mostly) move & attack, not attacking will quickly lower its duration, and you are [slowed](/Slow "Slow") after it ends.

[Ghouls](/Ghouls "Ghouls"), [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid"), [mummies](/Mummy "Mummy"), and bloodless [vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") cannot go berserk. There is a cooldown between berserks.

> *Normal:* A red film seems to cover your vision as you go berserk! You feel yourself moving faster!  
> You feel mighty!  
>
>
> *If already berserk:* You're already berserk!  
> *If -Berserk:* You're too exhausted to go berserk.  
> *Mummy, ghoul, or bloodless vampire:* You cannot raise a blood rage in your lifeless body.  
> *Formicid:* Your stasis prevents you from going berserk.  
> *If [mesmerised](/Mesmerise "Mesmerise") (not by the [obsidian axe](/Obsidian_axe "Obsidian axe")):* You are too mesmerised to rage.  
> *Affected by [Cause Fear](/Cause_Fear "Cause Fear"):* You are too terrified to rage.
>
> *Under the effect of [Death's Door](/Death%27s_Door "Death's Door"):* You can't enter a blood rage from death's door.

## History

- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), the berserk status gave the player a +5 [Strength](/Strength "Strength") bonus.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), this potion could be used after drawing the [Battlelust card](/Battlelust_card "Battlelust card") to cancel the effect entirely.

Type Potion
Name Potion of Berserk Rage
Icon
A potion which can send one into an incoherent rage.

Quaffing a potion of berserk rage makes you start berserking for 10 to 19 turns (weighted toward 15). Berserk increases HP by +50%, gives you might and haste, and makes you immune to sleep. However, your actions are limited to (mostly) move & attack, not attacking will quickly lower its duration, and you are slowed after it ends.

Ghouls, Formicids, mummies, and bloodless vampires cannot go berserk. There is a cooldown between berserks.

Normal: A red film seems to cover your vision as you go berserk! You feel yourself moving faster!
You feel mighty!

If already berserk: You're already berserk!
If -Berserk: You're too exhausted to go berserk.
Mummy, ghoul, or bloodless vampire: You cannot raise a blood rage in your lifeless body.
Formicid: Your stasis prevents you from going berserk.
If mesmerised (not by the obsidian axe): You are too mesmerised to rage.
Affected by Cause Fear: You are too terrified to rage.

Under the effect of Death's Door: You can't enter a blood rage from death's door.

History

  • Prior to 0.25, the berserk status gave the player a +5 Strength bonus.
  • Prior to 0.9, this potion could be used after drawing the Battlelust card to cancel the effect entirely.
